revised_title: Seismic Periodicity and Its Relation to Geographical Position and Intensity
tldr: This article investigates the annual and semi-annual seismic periods and their relationship to geographical position and intensity. The authors analyze earthquake records from various regions and find that the annual period has a maximum epoch in winter, while the semi-annual period has varying maximum epochs depending on the region. The study also discusses the connection between seismic periodicity and barometric pressure.
